hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is David is episode 1590
for a and today's date is June 18th 2018
and the title of the episode is how do
you destroy the central bank system
destroy the currency let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now the
central bank of all central bank's they
came out with a report today letting
everyone know that cryptocurrencies can
never be a currency and they created a
document it's called cryptocurrency
looking beyond the hype and it was
released by the Bank of International
Settlements and it explains the history
behind the technology and analyzes
cryptocurrencies to see if it can
actually become a currency and when you
really think about this the central bank
who doesn't want to give up control of
their currency system is analyzing
another currency system and letting you
know that it's not a currency that's
pretty much what they said because of
volatility scalability it will bring
down the internet they're using every
single excuse now think about what the
central banks have done since the
beginning they demonized cryptocurrency
they had a huge amount of dumps which
made Bitcoin volatile and remember
bitcoin is not all of cryptocurrency
it's the one that everyone knows about
and this is the one that they could use
to make everything look unstable and
basically this is what they've done now
they demonized it they made it look
volatile and they're pushing the idea
that this can never be a currency this
is why the Fed was out there many
different Talking Heads were saying that
yeah this doesn't meet a currency
standard now again this is coming from a
central bank they don't want to give up
control they love control and they're
trying to tell you that there is no
other system but theirs which is
absolutely ridiculous remember do you
really think the biz was going to come
out with a report saying hey crypto
currencies this is a perfect currency
solution we should all move to it
you should drop what we're using right
now no of course not
even if you created another currency
that they didn't control they would tell
you that that currency was no good and
even even if you made it out of paper
and ink and it was centralized and you
were creating it and the government
supported it and the private western
central banking system didn't control
they would tell you that that currency
is not a real currency that you can't
adopt that you need to adopt there's
this is what they've done in the past
this is what they're doing right now and
once again the central banks they do not
dictate to us what is or isn't a
currency the people decide what they
would like to use and what they're
trying to do right now is they're trying
to basically stop what is about to
happen they don't want people to decide
they want to decide for you so they're
heading this off with this report and
this is exactly what they're doing now
Jack Dorsey he came out and he did a
little tweeting and he basically
mentioned something called a cash app
where you can go and you can purchase
Bitcoin and sell Bitcoin this is I think
in New York and all of a sudden
cryptocurrency that it jumped but once
again what is happening here is more
vendors more corporations they're all
looking at cryptocurrency because first
of all it's not difficult to adopt
second of all it doesn't use as much
energy as everyone thinks think about
all the electronic appliances in your
house that where you basically the way
you think they're off they're not
they're all still running even though
you shut down the power they're all
still on draining energy do a little
experiment for a couple of weeks unplug
everything when you want to turn it off
and at the end of the month do it for
like a month or so and see what your
electric bill is so your TV your DVD
player your computer unplug the power
cable completely check it all out see if
you're using a lot of power just with
these devices now think about it think
about how many people have the phones
that compute
and all these other devices running all
the time even though you think they're
off they're not they're still draining
power and multiply that by the number of
homes compared to the number of people
that are mining crypto currencies so you
can see right now everyone is using a
lot of electrical power but what they're
doing is they're using this as an excuse
because they're trying to figure out a
way to divert everyone away from
cryptocurrencies this has been their
plan since the beginning and this is why
they came out with this report and if
you want to know more about
cryptocurrencies you want to learn about
cryptocurrencies you can go to the
cryptocurrency school which is at the
x-22 report school calm and we'll bring
to the website and you can read all
about the school you can read about the
trading room there and it will explain
everything to you now here in the United
States we understand that the economy is
not doing well we've been tracking this
we've been looking at all the
statistical information even the fake
information that the government puts out
the Fed puts out and even the corporate
media is reporting on all these
manipulated numbers to make us think
that everything is great but when we
start to look at what is really going on
in the economy we start to realize that
things are not well at all the national
Low Income Housing Coalition they came
out with this annual report and what
they're saying is that there's a gap
between wages and the price of housing
across the United States now I don't
think this is gonna come as a shocker to
anyone we've been talking about this for
a very long time
remember there's bubbles in the market
and since the 2008 crisis where housing
came down rents went up and now we have
housing being pushed up rents are still
up there they are coming down in many
different areas but the report is saying
that it's such a huge spread that people
cannot afford anything now the report's
housing wage is an estimate of what a
full-time worker on a state-by-state
basis must make to afford one or
two-bedroom rental homes at the Housing
and Urban Development fair market rent
without exceeding 30% of income on
housing expenses with decades of
declining wages and wining wealth
inequality via the financialization of
corporate America and thanks to the
Federal Reserve disastrous policies the
recent insignificant counter trend in
wage growth for low-income workers has
not been enough to boost their standard
of living the report finds that a
full-time minimum-wage worker or the
average American stuck in the gig
economy which we talked about before
cannot afford to rent a two-bedroom
apartment anywhere in the US according
to the report the 2018 National Housing
wage is 22 dollars and 10 cents for a
two-bedroom rental home and $17.90 for a
one-bedroom rental home now across the
country the two-bedroom housing wage
ranges from 13.8 efore cents in Arkansas
to 36 dollars and 13 cents in Hawaii the
five cities with the highest two-bedroom
housing wages are Stanford Norwalk
Connecticut at $38 Honolulu at 39
Oakland Fremont California which is at
44 San Jose which is in California at 48
dollars in San Francisco which is at 60
dollars so for people earning minimum
wage which could be most Millennials
stuck in the gate economy the situation
is beyond dire at $7.25 per hour these
individuals would need to work a hundred
and twenty-two hours per week or
approximately three full-time jobs to
afford a two-bedroom rental at HUDs fair
market rent for a one-bedroom these
individuals will need to work 99 hours
per week or hold at least two full-time
jobs the average renter in each county
across the u.s. makes enough to afford a
two-bedroom in only eleven percent of
counties and one bedroom in just 43% so
you can see that most of America they're
having a very difficult time and this is
because we're seeing the wealth effect
where a lot of the wealth is being shot
up to the 1%
the rest of America they are struggling
what has happened well the full-time
high-paying jobs they completely
disappeared now these individuals have
one to three part-time jobs and you just
can't work that number of hours to
afford anything this is why people are
using the gig economy or gig jobs where
they're having side jobs where they're
doing things on the internet selling
things in eBay or Etsy or things like
that
trying to make ends meet but for many it
is not working whatsoever now we
understand that the housing market is in
big trouble and banks well they are
pulling back from mortgage lending right
now I wonder why they're doing that well
they're doing that because they
understand there's going to be major
problems and they don't want to be
holding all of these mortgages they've
done this before and they know that when
the next crisis hits they can't be
holding all these mortgages so the
shadow banking system well that has
become very very aggressive and in the
first quarter of 2018 banks and non-bank
mortgage lenders the shadow banks
originated around 1.8 1 million loans
for residential properties in the
diversified US mortgage industry the top
ten baek's shadow banks alone originated
260,000 mortgages or 14% of the total
amounting to 75 billion banks are
institutions that take deposits and use
those deposits to fund part of their
lending activities the other part is
through fractional banking so they're
watched over by the federal and state
bank regulators from the Fed on down now
since the financial crisis and the
bailouts they were forced to increase
their capital cushions which are now
large non baked lenders do not take
deposits and thus have to fund their
lending in other ways including by
borrowing from big banks and issuing
bonds they're not regulated by bank
regulators and their capital cushions
are very minimal during the last
mortgage crisis the non-bank mortgage
lenders were the first to collapse
were bailed out so the top 10 mortgage
lenders in the first quarter of 2018 are
as follows
Wells Fargo used to be the largest
mortgage lender in the United States
until fairly recently but it felt a
second place and who took its spot a
shadow bank the largest mortgage lender
in the first quarter was Quicken Loans
its total mortgage originations
edged down 3% to 73,000 896 mortgages so
Wells Fargo used to be number one now a
shadow bank that doesn't take deposits
where they're not regulated they are now
number one and if you look down the list
you will see that like Loan Depot is
number four you'll see other ones that
are number five number six and they're
all taking the spots of the big banks
this is going to be a disaster when
everything starts to fall apart and the
big banks they knew this this is why
they're offloading all of this to the
shadow banking system so they get hit
first and they gobble them up just like
they did in the financial crisis we
understand that the economy is breaking

where they can point fingers at

it's based on spending and if people

one bedroom place we understand that
these individuals are not gonna go out

and this is why retail is breaking down
no it's not going to online the whole

now countries realize that all of this

nine point three billion and they're

Note it's an instrument of debt so right
now the dollar is in demand this is only

all the stimulus and everything like

now the consumers and corporate buyers
